events.title: Great Fire of Rome begins
events.description: A major fire breaks out in Rome, which lasts for six days and causes widespread destruction across the city.
events.significance: The fire leads to significant rebuilding efforts under Emperor Nero and has long-lasting impacts on Roman urban planning and architecture.

events.title: Scopes Trial begins
events.description: The trial of John T. Scopes starts in Dayton, Tennessee, for teaching evolution in a public school, challenging the Butler Act prohibiting such teachings.
events.significance: The trial becomes a landmark case in the debate between science and religion in education and highlights issues of academic freedom.

events.title: Roswell UFO incident occurs
events.description: An unidentified flying object reportedly crashes near Roswell, New Mexico, sparking conspiracy theories and government cover-up allegations.
events.significance: The incident fuels UFO lore and remains a popular subject in discussions on extraterrestrial life and government secrecy.

events.title: Comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 impacts Jupiter
events.description: Fragments of the comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 collide with Jupiter, observed by telescopes worldwide, marking the first direct observation of extraterrestrial collisions.
events.significance: The event provides valuable data on planetary impacts and Jupiter's atmosphere, advancing understanding of cometary dynamics.
